meanings.definition: A unit of linear measure equal to one twelfth of a foot.
meanings.sent1: She measured the table using inches.
meanings.sent2: The ruler has markings in inches and centimeters.
meanings.sent3: The inchworm traveled one inch at a time.
meanings.sent4: His patience was wearing thin, inch by inch.
meanings.sent5: The inch of snow made the road slippery.

meanings.definition: To move slowly and carefully in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: The cat inches closer to the mouse.
meanings.sent2: He inches his way through the crowded room.
meanings.sent3: The snail inches along the garden path.
meanings.sent4: She inches towards the finish line in the race.
meanings.sent5: The car inches forward in the traffic jam.

meanings.definition: To enclose or separate with a fence or other barrier.
meanings.sent1: They decided to inch the garden with a wooden fence.
meanings.sent2: The farmer inches the livestock with electric wire.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully inch their friend with a jump rope.
meanings.sent4: The wall inches the property from the neighbor's land.
meanings.sent5: The security guard inches the area with caution tape.
